title: SYCL
description: The "Share Your Code License". This is an in progress license.

must.title: Give Credit
must.description: Describes the need to give explicit credit to the author when distributing the software.

must.title: State Changes
must.description: Stating significant changes made to software.

must.title: Rename
must.description: Describes the ability to change software's name if modified/distributed.

cannot.title: Use Patent Claims
cannot.description: Describes the rights to practice patent claims of contributors to the code.

cannot.title: Hold Liable
cannot.description: Describes the warranty and if the software/license owner can be charged for damages.

cannot.title: Use Trademark
cannot.description: Describes the allowance of using contributors' names, trademarks or logos.

cannot.title: Private Use
cannot.description: Describes the ability to use/modify software freely without distributing it.

cannot.title: Commercial Use
cannot.description: Describes the ability to use the software for commercial purposes.

can.title: Distribute
can.description: Describes the ability to distribute original or modified (derivative) works.

can.title: Modify
can.description: Describes the ability to modify the software and create derivatives.

can.title: Statically Link
can.description: Describes whether the library can be compiled into the program (linked at compile time rather than runtime, aka dynamic linking).

can.title: Sublicense
can.description: Describes the ability for you to grant/extend a license to the software.

fulltext:
TERMS AND CONDITIONS

0. Definitions

a. "License" means this document.

b. "Licensable" means having the right to grant, to the maximum extent possible, whether at the time of the initial grant or subsequently, any and all of the rights conveyed by this License.

c. "Covered Software" refers to any copyrightable work licensed under this License.

d. "Contributor" means each individual or legal entity that creates, contributes to the creation of, or owns the Covered Software.

e. "Larger Work" means a work that combines Covered Software with other material, in a separate file or files, that is not Covered Software.

f. "Derivative Works" refers to any work that is based on (or derived from) the Covered Software and for which the editorial revisions, annotations, elaborations, or other modifications represent, as a whole, an original work of authorship. For the purposes of this License, Derivative Works shall not include works that remain separable from, or merely link (or bind by name) to the interfaces of, the Covered Software and Derivative Works thereof.

g. "Source" means the preferred form for making modifications, including but not limited to software source code, documentation source, and configuration files.
